page.title: 01Liss in the Rother Valley
page.content: Liss ia village divided by the main London to Portsmouth Railway Line. The original village, Lysse, is to found west of railway. much modern residential development has taken place in the last 30 years to the east of the railway. This continues with a current major development in the centre of the village of houses, flats and shops. The villae lies between two ranegs of hills, the hangers and the southdowns both of which are designted as areas of outstanding beauty,it is a rural area with most of the working population commuting north and south to the major towns. The population is continually changing with the emphasis on young families although there are still a nucleus of 'old' Liss families. There are a number of retirement and nursing homes.
